review: I believe this should have five stars because the service is great and your kids won't be complaining until the food is served because their is crayons and paper for games and that would keep them occupied.The food looks so good.

How is this place still functioning ?  How ? I was here on December 24 in the afternoon doing the last minute shopping in atlas park when my daughter was a little hungry.  We went here and this Hispanic female  waitress was the worse ever I have seen.  I received the check and notice that new customers came in and this other waitress gives them bread with oil right away. When I later questioned my waitress about why didn't she serve us bread, her response was that they ran out of bread and that they had to go pick up , which  is a total lie.  Then I was waiting for her to pick up my check and I decided to go where the kitchen area is at because she was by the cashier .  I wanted my daughters food to go as well as my pizza .  This guy that works there took my daughters pasta and my pizza and put it in a pizza box.  How gross is that.  That was the most disgusting thing I ever saw in my life.  Not only did he do that, but my daughter had chicken in her pasta and I am a vegetarian.   He put everything all over the pizza box.   Gross and disgusting.  Also unprofessional.   This place has bad reviews and they should start looking into the manager here because apparently there is something wrong with this place.  Wake up manager.  Your doing a poor job

Having been given ye 'ole double thumbs up by a good friend with a bad palate, I pretty much had my expectations set -- and the settings were right. Petite Wedge is called a few different things at  various eateries, it seems that its the first word that changes, but Wedge word remains. I didn't really enjoy it unfortunately, Roma tomatoes - good, blue cheese - bad, if anything is anything -- lettuce is lettuce and it was and it was and I've no idea who Neuski is.  Being a lover of Thai food, the Thai Chicken Spring Tortilla Rolls really sounded good although I'm not a fan of the listed calorie intake model.  A bit too many sproutish greens, a little too little Thai Chicken was confined in their smallish Tortilla cocoon. The peanut sauce was quite good and I contemplated asking for a smattering to go. But after reflecting upon the slow and semi dismissive service, I thought it better to pay and leave.

I always enjoyed coming here but just had the worst pizza ever with very minimal toppings...for $15 you should be tasting the toppings in every bite. The service was lackluster at best the servers seem to be more interested in talking to each other than taking care of their guests. The best part of the whole diner was the desert but you really have to try to screw up desert. Prob won't dine here again

My husband and I went there around 9:30 pm to grab late dinner and even though the restaurant was closing at 10 pm they still took us in and served us. They seated us right away and were very kind. The waiter gave us enough time to look at our menus before he came to serve us. They greeted us with Bread and olive oil and water. Then they came up and let us order. We ordered the chicken garlic pizza and tomato basil soup. The soup was a little cold but I was not going to complain due to the fact that they were closing soon. I also ordered an orchid sangria which was so delicious! So try it if you are a wine drinker. Now the chicken garlic pizza was not bad but not the best I still like the Hawaiian better but my husband and I wanted to try something different! For a quick dinner cali pizza is the place to go! Good food and great service

Food: 3.0/5.0 Service: 2.5/5.0 Value: 3.0/5.0 Decor: 3.0/5.0 Overall: 3.0/5.0  Ended up in area one day and stopped by to pick up a pie.  Standard CPK fare with no surprises, though the center it's located in leaves something to be desired.

Agh I came here on a Sunday brunch. I figured that I should come back as the Carne Asada I had last time was so good. Bad idea.  Service was the worst and our food was not cooked to perfection. The pizzas themselves looked sloppy, as I could tell they just made it in a rush The taste was not authentic. Even the sauce that comes with the Carne Asada was super super bitter. We got the California club as well. It had a lot of lettuce but barely any bacon or avocado. Stick to the carne asada, as it has a better rep. However, DO NOT COME HERE DURING BUSY TIMES on weekends! Disappointed.

Been to California Pizza Kitchen before but never really to eat. I've always hung out by the bar to watch a game and have a drink because they make good cocktails. For my first time eating there I can say the food was ok. The chicken for my chicken Milanese was tasty but I didn't like the presentation. It was just buried under a bed of arugula and cheese. I do feel they have a wide array of choices to select from. The service was ok.  The bolognese spaghetti was nothing to write home about as 2 people from my table felt that it tasted bland. The sauce did not stand out. My mother thought her fettuccine was ok but nothing to rave about.  The true winner is the pizza! Ordered three cheeses and carne asada pizza and it was delicious. I would definitely order those again. I also like the appearance of the place. Good prices and decent food

Had a great time here for my son's twelfth birthday. The ambiance was pleasant. Our waiter was really nice and informative. The food was great! I had the garlic Alfredo with chicken and shrimp. The sauce was perfect. Great amount of shrimp and chicken, worth the price. I can't wait to go back soon.

The star rating is for service only. I doubt I saw any employee smile the hour I was there. No one spoke to us in a friendly tone. The service was S L O W. We were seated almost immediately. The waiter took our drink and food order soon thereafter. However, we did not receive our beverages for at least 20 minutes. The food arrived another 20 minutes later. We ordered lettuce wraps and ONE pizza. I won't even discuss the wait for the check OR the amount of waiting for the waiter to return with the credit card.  This was my first time at California Pizza Kitchen. Is it normal to wait 40 minutes for a pizza? The food was great but I doubt I'll return .. customer service is key ladies and gents!

I have came to this location multiple times until  I was satisfied. Paid $16 for a small pizza and only had six pieces of tiny steak on it. Really disappointed. Honestly don't know what happened unless something changes I will not be paying $16 for this overpriced pizza.24October17
love cpk nevee been to this one but everything was great. didnt have a chance to have the sangria this time. thai chicken pizza was delicious

I'm a recent CPK fan only b/c there weren't too many of their locations where I lived in LI and Queens. Luckily, this location is close by and happy I can experience some of their delicious food (b/c honestly, you sometimes crave it).  I go to this location during off peak hours (weekdays around 2 or 3pm) and although I never had a horrible experience, I've never had a perfect experience. Yes, there staff is always polite and the servers are generally good but for off peak hours, I feel like it's still a little off.  Cons - Every time I go there, I always receive dirty appetizer plates such as dried, leftover food remnants the dishwasher couldn't quite remove. One time, the bottom plate was previously used and it somehow go to my table. Ew. - Although the restaurant is generally slow, it's always hard to get our server's attention. I would expect that during peak hours so I'm just a little confused at why their attentiveness isn't great. Pros - The food is pretty consistent every time I go there and I can't complain. You know what you're getting at CPK and this location delivers. I haven't had a bad meal yet (jinx!). - The managers there are great. Specifically Don O'Niel and Drew. About a month ago, I called the restaurant asking to speak to a manager about my dining experience earlier that afternoon. Although the server was nice, it was apparent he needed additional training. Don listened and seemed genuinely concerned about the service we received and offered complimentary apps for our next visit. I took advantage of the offer yesterday and although Don wasn't there, Drew, the manager that day, honored the request with no issues at all. I'll definitely return knowing that the managers care about the customer's experience. Thanks again Don and Drew! - There's outdoor seating, so that's always a plus!
It's alright. My fave thing here is the sangria and their buffalo cauliflower. It really takes like buffalo chicken wing lol!

Ok so I've been to this CPK a few times and I think the biggest issue is consistency. Sometimes your order is great sometimes it's not. I usually get the BBQ chicken salad to go, no dress extra BBQ sauce on the side. This last time was disappointing. The chicken looked like it was leftover from something else and there wasn't much of it, my side of BBQ sauce (which I basically use as dressing) I was given the small container and it wasn't even 1/4 full (usually they'll give the large with a good amount of BBQ sauce in it.) the tortilla strips in the salad were a bit stale. Again... Consistency, I've had this salad before from this location it's been great!  The bread that comes with it was in a small plastic bag with the oil, the oil opened and spilt all over it so it wasn't edible. Not really their fault but perhaps should look into a different way to store that for to go orders. In honesty I wasn't going to eat the bread anyways so this helped me out. I'll definitely go back because I've had better experiences than this one, and when the salad is made correctly it's a really good salad.

This was horrible.   I went for my sons 14th Birthday  I thought since it was mid day around 230 it's dead you would think service should be at its game.  Sorry I went.    I had movie tickets for Justice League at 420 and they took so long to serve the food.  Then once the meal came the waitress never came to check up on us.  I had to get up at 410 to say hey.  My movie is in 10min I like to see the desert menu to celebrate my sons birthday with a cake.  She gave me the desert with the food still on table. She never picked up the dinner.  Now I'm sitting there with empty plates of food and desert.  Oh I gave her candles for my sons cake. She gave me back the candles didn't even put them on the cake.  I would never go back.  I refuse to give her a tip.

Came back here after a few years. Def not as good as it used to be. Not horrible but not amazing (at least what I had). I ordered the waldorf salad and it was okay. I want to know why I got 4 lil pieces of chicken they tried to swindle me with inside of that high spring mix salad for $16?! My friend ordered the protein bowl as a healthier option and said she liked it. We did order the peach sangria and I liked that! Give the sangria a try to see if you like any of them. Our server was friendly and came in a timely manner with our food. Luckily, I didn't experience what I see a lot of reviews mentioning, miserable ppl/service.  Would I come back? Sure, but would get a pizza or something else. I def would not wait an hour to come eat here.

Very attractive place. We sat down for lunch on Friday and we were forgotten about. She finally came over and was cute about it but as a server she was not good. Extremely heavy handed and it seemed line she did not want to be there. Food was OK, we both had soup and salad and again just ok, my salad came out incorrect. A child's party was breaking up when we got there. While we were sitting, waiting for someone to come over, the person in charge of reorganizing the restaurant after the kids party, was kind enough to drag the 56 metal chair the 48 feet across the stone floor to where it belonged.  We could not hear each other for 10 minutes.  The place was not busy and the whole staff seemed in the weeds the whole time. The 8 million dollars they spent on the place should have been $7,900,000.00 and spent $100,000.00 on employee training but they never do.......

It's CPK! I haven't had this place in years. After a movie, a friend and I decided why not...we love pizza, let's get pizza! What was ordered: Sesame Chicken Dumplings..not my fav b/c they were wet lol. I'm a pan fried dumpling person. BBQ chicken pizza...yummy, but not as good as it use to be.  Pepperoni pizza...good ole faithful! Berry Honey Sangria...a little on the too sweet side Nonetheless, it's a good spot for something quick if you're in the area.

Always good food , and guaranteed outstanding service . Teressa been here for a while , so she's a CPK expert . Takes orders in a timely fashion and very attentive . Appetizers : I like the crispy Mac and cheese or the avocado eggrolls . Wanna talk pizza? Chipotle chicken pizza and dessert is all about the butter cake !

Honestly, everytime I go here I enjoy my experience. There never a problem. The food is always always delicious and presented really well. The pizza is always top of the line but so are many of the other dishes, they don't only specialize in pizza. The appetizer I always for are the Spring Rolls. There are 3 options: Veggie, Thai & Baha Chicken. The veggie option I always get (although I am no vegetarian) it's just as delectable. It comes with eggplant on the inside with other vegetables and the taste is just as wowwing. They never disappoint. This location is in the heart of Atlas Mall so it does experience a rush every now & then but don't let it stop you from going. Bon Appetite!
Always happy with the food and the service here. My wife and I usually always sit at the bar and it's always a great time. Never had a bad meal or a bad experience here and we go maybe once a month.

Have been going there for months - now they no longer accept debit cards or credit cards that don't have a chip - have been using my debit card for months with no problem and not all credit cards have chips - took almost 1/2 hour to pay because while there were very few customers the server was very slow and then had to deal with a very rude manager - would not set foot in there again even if they offered me a million dollars - they suck!!!!

Dropped by here for a quick bite with my husband and I must say our server was so considerate with my new diet and she gave me a quick run down of her recommendations.  She made my new vegan ways a bit much easier which is always a plus. Thank you Nina you a rockstar in my book :) for those who are headed towards that route and having difficulty choosing a friendly vegan restaurant I would considering coming here. Thanks again Nina!!!

I've always wanted to try a CPK because my friends use to hype it up and say it was really good(this was a couple years ago), nonetheless back then I thought the only one that existed in NY was in Manhattan and wasn't willing to made the trip so I was ecstatic to accidentally find a CPK in Atlas Park! We came in for Valentine's Day lunch and were seated right away. There's a lot of booths here for families or couples to sit, bar seats where you can watch the pizza cook, and little tables scattered all over. So, yeah-- they are definitely not short on seats! They have a menu that includes a "seasonal" section that changes with the seasons. I decided to order the mahi mahi tacos w/ a magherita pizza(I mean of course you have to get a pizza!) It took a little bit for our starter to come, bread w/ olive oil. In fact, it took so long I didn't even know there would be starters. The starter was just okay. The mahi mahi tacos were delicious to me, full of sauce and just cooked to perfection. The pizza was not bad either. Nothing was spectacular about these two entrees and I probably would not consider coming back to have them.

I really liked the open kitchen. The food was pretty good. The wedge salad had far too much blue cheese dressing and the service was.....Okay. the drinks were great and the pizzas are a great size and very filling.

My family and I enjoy this restaurant every time we go to atlas park mall. It's very children friendly and accommodating. I like the salads and my husband loves the salad. My favorite used to be the chicken Milanese entree which I still love but it's not very diet friendly. I use the CPK app and they email me perks and offers which is a nice touch. During Some holidays like Easter they host special brunch meals which is very nice.

Great place to go for lunch and dinner. Their butter cake is literally one of the greatest cakes mixed with ice cream you will ever have! It is very unique and delicious! I love their pizza! The crust is perfect. Their pasta could have a little bit of work sometimes! Not always! Sometimes the pasta is a little hard but its not terrible. The service is great. I would recommend this california pizza kitchen any day. My favorite part about the restaurant is the fact that their drinks are amazing. The cucumber green sweet drink is insanee!! And the strawberry mango one is just as good! Im probaby going to head back to this california pizza kitchen in like a week or two haha.

Update came here on a busy Friday night my Family and I were quickly seated. With in minutes our waitress was bringing us menus and taking our orders the place was packed but our food came out fast. Like always the food was cooked perfectly and delicious. After a wonderful dinner the manager came by to see how are meal was the staff was very attentive and the service was excellent looking forward to coming here again

Went Friday afternoon, it wasn't busy, the waitress wasn't very good, we would see her go checking on tables with the white customers, while me and my sister waited 25 minutes to order a pizza, I actually had to grab a different waitress to put in our order, the Mac and cheese balls we ordered were burnt and the pizza was mostly dough and dry, its like they only put toppings in the middle, I say go to a real pizza joint since there's so many in the neighborhood

Always a pleasure when I visit California Pizza Kitchen. I normally go to the Park Ave location, however being that it was on a Sunday I didn't want to drive into the city and sit in traffic; so Glendale location it was! My bartender Kris was very awesome! She got to know the people I came with and educated us on the drinks! I ordered something like a seafood wrap and the wrap was an actual lettuce I would use to put the food inside of to make it into a wrap. I defiantly planning on going back and I hope she is my bartender again!!

Typical CPK located in the Atlas Park Mall in Glendale. Pretty large space that is usually full up on prime nights during the week and weekend. Service was quick and efficient. Place is well kept and clean. One minor issue is if you are sitting by the front, people will ignore the "please use the revolving door" sign and it may get a bit drafty.  The pizzas have a nice thin crust, and good toppings. Desserts are good as well.  Also, for people on Weight Waters, all of their items are already in the points system.

Sitting at the bar when there is a 90-minute wait is literally the only option when you're craving great crafted artisan pizza   -said no one ever. At least not about this place.          I came in to meet a friend, they picked the place, and we just kept it simple, apps, drinks and desserts.  the drinks took a while, especially if you are physically sitting at the bar, apps came out soon after our drinks arrived, and the dessert's took the longest.  Once we finally got them which was our Chocolate cake and our Key Lime Pie a la mode. Whipped cream and ice cream were practically melted all over the plate, along with our check. When we tried to get the server's attention to let him know we weren't content with the vanilla flood on our plates, he was way out of reach. no one was in our visuals close by except the man and woman making pizza's right in front of us. it was a bit annoying.  We reluctantly paid, gave a sensible tip against our better judgement, and left.  I've enjoyed the 'Breakfast with Santa' and other events they've hosted here, i'll even tolerate the busy server running around on a Friday night, but neglect on a regular day during a seven day week isn't acceptable.

The service was spectacular.the waitress Melanie Delgado did a great job, but the food was terrible. I hope that the chef read this review and I try to improve his food. I went there sunday 3rd september 2:00 pm. Thanks Melanie Delgado.

I came here today during lunch hours . The worst service I've ever encountered. Our waitress ( over weight and blond hair) was extremely unfriendly. Either she had a bad day or was prejudice, because she seemed fine with her Caucasian customers. The service was so slow, I couldn't even believe it. 45 min wait for food ? I already waited past 10 minutes for my water and drinks, the least you can do is tell us the food will be out shortly or check up on how we're doing. After the food came out , our waitress disappeared  again and never asked if we needed anything. Between the service and food, I will never be coming back.

I highly don't recommend this restaurant, the food was mediocre and the staff are terrible. The waiter  said he was "to busy" to collect our check and when he returned for the check (10 minutes later) he messed up the change and kept 21$. We then sat in there for an hour arguing with him because he said he was confused on the change and then pulls cash out of his pocket. He then gets the manger who told us that we still owe 21$ (the exact amount he didn't give back). We then explained to the manger and he gave us a 20$ credit to the table.

Worst service, my sister in law and I took our children here on a Friday afternoon, we were seated fairly quick but they placed us in the most un kid friendly seating(extremely wobbly), it was right in the middle of the restaurant in a round table which made us feel cramped as all the other tables were surrounding us and the waiters had to squeeze through. Our drinks took about 15 mins to arrive then our food all came separately first came the children's about 25 mins after ordering. Our food took a good 30 mins after the children's so by time time we were eating the children had already finished theirs which for anyone who has children knows that if they are not entertained then they will not sit still. The manager was going around each table to ask how everyone was doing except to ours.

Have been a fan and loyal patron of CPK for quite some time now. Not much to complain about when it comes to this location. Occasionally the wait may be a bit long, but other than that the food and service have always been perfectly fine. Love their sangria, as well as the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza. Servers are also always very friendly and the food usually comes out pretty quick. Never a bad experience at CPK.

I've always wanted to try California Pizza Kitchen so we came here.  I love the food but the service not so much. I want to give this place 4 stars but I just can't. We were a party of 7 and we were seated quickly. We all sat down and waited 15 minutes for the waitress to ask us what we wanted to drink. Then, she took our drinks down and talked to her friend for another 5 minutes before giving us our drinks, we had to call her a few times before she came to us. Then, she must've misheard one of us and gave us so much attitude for the wrong order. For appetizers we got he crispy mac n cheese, spinach artichoke dip (with pita instead of chips), and the avocado club egg rolls. These were delicious, however the crispy mac n cheese wasn't that special. The BBQ chicken pizza was good but after a few bites it didn't have that wow factor anymore. The chicken in the salads (quinoa and arugula/ Cesar) had this burnt taste to it but the salad itself was amazing. Lastly, the garlic chicken and mushroom fettuccine was my favorite dish, the portions were great and I was stuffed. Overall, the waitress did not make us feel welcomed and she gave us so much attitude while we were there. I felt like she was only nice to us at the end when she gave us the check for her tip. The food was good, so I think I would only go back for that.

This place is so eh. Food is eh. Service is even more eh. I've come here multiple times and had wrong orders or slow service. I usually just avoid at all costs in all honesty, but I do enjoy their spinach dip.

The service was terrible. Came in got seated right way. After that it took our server about 10 mins plus to come and ask for our drink order. When she did come to the table, we decided to order drinks and food because it would take a long time for her to bring the food. So as we figured, if took her 15mins plus to bring the drinks......I  would understand if it was crowded but is WASN'T. The food finally came....  after 15 mins plus. I was almost finished with my food before she came over to ask how everything was. AND NOW FOR THE FINALE SHE SENDS ANOTHER SERVER TO THE TABLE WITH THE CHECK.....THIS WAS MY FIRST TIME TO CALIFORNIA PIZZA AND MY LAST TIME.
The Waldorf salad is amazing , I'm still disappointed that they never brought back carne asada pizza. Service can be slow but they are usually pretty good with everything else.

Worst restaurant experience I've ever had. Ordered two plates, got one of them. Over 40 minutes went by and we hadn't gotten our second one. The server said it would take longer because the steak was frozen, it had been way too long and we asked to get it wrapped to take home. I had been trying not to eat my food waiting for my boyfriend to get his, and my food got cold so I asked for them to wrap it to go as well. When they brought what was supposed to be my food, I felt it was too light, when I opened it, there were two tiny potatoes inside the box. Went to the manager, manager did not pay mind. Terrible experience!

Ordered the gluten free pizza togo, not greasy but I guess thats what makes it a bit more healthy, pretty small (10 inch)  By the time the pizza got home, the crust started to stick to the box. I understand how hard it is to perfect gluten free and I think if they added more flavor to the pizza it would be better as well.

They've rebranded their entire look. Same menu with some refined new items. They have a cute little plant adorned wine rack/stand at the entrance, which is a nice welcome.  Food is always great, service is consistently good and the drinks are the bomb.

I've always wanted to try a California Pizza Kitchen and after attending an event at Atlas Park, my sister, husband and I decided to go.  Needless to say due to the two stars--I was less than impressed. Starting with the service, we put our name in and were told 25-30 minutes. We returned after 20 minutes to find that they had already called our name but luckily they seated us right away. Our waiter was very nice but kept us waiting constantly. Hubs ordered a soda and when it was brought to the table he found that it was completely flat--he let the waiter know and the waiter apologized and brought him another soda--this one flatter than the first! You could actually see that it was completely clear, wouldn't the waiter notice that? Then once our food came we had no napkins or utensils.  I wasn't impressed by the pizza. I got a classic Margarita pizza and something was off about it. My sister also did not completely enjoy her salad.  I think my lust for CPK was pushing it. Now that I've tried it--I don't think I will be again.

Horrible service.very rude waitress.once we were seated one unhappy blond waitress around her 50  approched to us .We ordered pizzas and drinks.she didnt even inruduced herself or greet us.when we were still eating one slice pizza left on each ours plates she stopped by saing"do you want a dessert?".i looked at my boyfriend and asked him we said "no" and she throw our check on table saying" when you will be ready ".Is this how your CPK staff is trained????i just was shocked. When we were putting a tip in bill folder ,she was insolently looking standing close to us, how much are we puting in. This server is pathetic !!!!your people are getting worst.not polite at all.showing customers bad attitude. I have been your costomer for over 6 years (this location).but it's time to find other restaurant.for real!!!!never coming back!!!!!

I had a wonderful time...the Easter event was a success.  Gina was a delightful hostess and was kind enough to tell us about the menu and help take family photos with the Easter bunny. The food was good and plentiful. The drinks were good. The service was good. I can't wait to come back to try out the rest of the menu.

I went to the one in Atlas Mall. It was crowded but we were seated swiftly.  Our waiter was speedy and efficient, and the food was SCRUMPTIOUS. I had a pasta dish and the boyfriend had a pizza. Loved it!
Slow service....waitress could not keep up with customers in our area...had to ask for basics several time.....no utensils....no plates...bad !

I've been coming to the CPK in Glendale since it opened a couple of years ago. The restaurant has gone through its fair share of managers, menu options and physical changes throughout the years. I remember always loving the fresh taste of their food and would frequently visit, despite my aversion to food chains. However, I had a bad experience at the restaurant about 6 months ago that put me on a CPK hiatus. I was a little apprehensive about returning, but I'm glad that I did because this time the service and food were wonderful. We had an extremely attentive waitress that would frequently check up on us and would refill our drinks and bread baskets using what seemed like telepathy. We never had to flag her down. The managers and waitress cheerfully waited on us throughout our stay. The food was equally great. We ordered the spinach artichoke pizza from the fall menu and it was delectable; delicious notes of garlic and a creamy spinach sauce. We also ordered the Tostada pizza (Tex-Mex inspired) and the classic 5 cheese pizza. We got the Barbecue Chopped Salad to top it all off, and we doused EVERYTHING in their magical ranchito sauce. That sauce tastes like it was crafted by cherubs and made exclusively for the gods. If you visit CPK, do yourself a favor and get a side of the ranchito (trust me). For dessert we ordered several servings of the Butter Cake (a cult classic) and the salted caramel pudding (which I tried for the first time and Hallelujah!)  We had an awesome time at the restaurant, and my faith in CPK has been restored.

Went there Monday night with the wife and kids for a quick bite not expecting a 5 star meal with first class service . And I was right . It's mediocre food with mediocre service . Nothing to write home about . The server was friendly and prompt with our requests so I won't fault him for that. It's not his fault the food is what it is .

Last night I came here with family and the food was great. I ordered the white corn and guacamole dip with tortilla chips for my appetizer. For my entree, I had the Margherita pizza. Everything was amazing. I will be back soon

Where do I even begin? I arrived on a Monday early afternoon hoping to grab a bite to eat and leave. Let me just say.. service was horrible. There was no rush and the restaurant was empty. Restaurant was clean and well kept. Our server wasn't the most social and didn't keep tabs on our table, at all. To the point where my boyfriend had to get up and fetch his soda from the bar from a miserable looking woman who wouldn't even take his glass but had him hold it across the bar. When the issue was addressed to the assistant general manager Don, he didn't care. He was very nonchalant about the situation. To make matters worse, he gives us comp small plate cards for our next visit which expires in July. It was like a slap in the face and giving excuses like "we only have 2 waitresses"..  not a paying patrons problem. Instead of rectifying the situation properly, what makes you think I would even spend another penny at cpk? What's worse.. the general manager mike was hiding in the back and didn't even bother to show his face. It was poorly handled but thankfully Mike the kitchen manager handled a customer service issue. Does that even make sense to have the kitchen manager handle a customer complaint about service and not food? Save your money and go elsewhere as the staff look miserable and the assistant and general manager don't give a "bleep" about anything but leaving when their shift ends. Still have no idea how  the GM and AGM have their jobs or positions. Zero stars.

45 minutes for sandwiches and salad. Other people came after us and got served before us. Another family with children left before getting food. We were contemplating leaving too. The worst part is we were ignored the whole time. I had to ask for refills, I had to ask for sugar and milk for my mother in laws tea. My food was ok but my wife's salad wasn't outstanding for the wait time.  The last 4 visits have not been well. I gave it enough chances. I am done... Oh btw they took my favorite chicken Caesar salad sandwich on herb cheese focaccia off the menu...

Very dissatisfied with this CPK located in Atlas Park.  I've been going to this spot for as long as I've been living in the neighborhood (4 years) and I've NEVER experienced a bad visit until now.   The quality of the food is good.  Lots better than Chili's, which is located in Atlas Park as well.    The service, however, has changed dramatically and not for the better.   I went yesterday with my son because I wanted to have their rib eye, which is very good.  Even though for some reason I can't get a steak medium as I've asked for, more than once. Since I've noticed that service has been declining at this location, I started my timer on my phone to see how long it would take a waiter to come to our table.  It took almost 10 minutes for a waiter to come to our table and it was only because my son flagged down the hostess and informed her that we had been waiting 10 minutes and no one had come to take our order.   Florian finally came to our table and took our drink order and since we had so much time to look at the menu, took our entree order as well.  We noticed that Florian was the only one working the section we were in, so we really can't blame him as we noticed two waitresses walk in while we were waiting at the table.  We assumed they ran late.  The whole process took so long...almost an hour and we had not been served our drinks that we left.  I made sure to tell the hostess so that she was aware that we had been waiting so long, it was unacceptable.  And by the way, the location was no busier than it normally is on a Sunday at that time (early afternoon).   We ended up going to Chili's, which was just as busy, perhaps, busier since their restaurant is much bigger than CPK, was seated right away and I don't think we waited 3 minutes before our waitress came to our table and took our drink order. CPK is still a very good restaurant.  The food is great, but it doesn't matter if the service is not on point.

I love coming here for the great food and warm ambience.  I'm obsessed with their salads - either the BBQ Chicken or Crispy Thai, I always have a hard time to decide which to order.  For spicy pizza lovers, I highly recommend the spicy chipotle chicken pizza. Comes with a tangy green sauce. Delicious!!!

This place is not what it used to be. I've been going to CPK to years, and all I can say is the experience has gone from great, to good, to not bad, to awful.  Management has fired so many of my favorites, removed so many items from the menu that my family and I love, and seem to have a generally poor knowledge of how to treat their guests. You can see it clear as day on the faces of the employees; they are not happy working there.  The last two times I have visited this place, I have overheard managers bad mouthing their own employees within earshot of our table.  Tonight was the last time I plan on spending any of my money in this place. Do yourselves a favor, when you're in Atlas Park, go to Chilis..

This place is so quiet during the week!  I really love that.  I went with a group of friends.  We tend to order the same things, our favs.  The argula salad is really tasty with sliced of parmesan cheese, nuts and a light vinaigrette.  I'm still in love with the white corn guac.  Really tasty and they give you an abundance of chips to go with it.  I tried the shrimp scampi with zucchini.  It was just ok for me.  Needed a lot more cheese on it.  The service was good as usually and the butter cake is moist and comes with Haagen Dazs vanilla ice cream.   Can't go wrong with that!

I can understand that we all get bad service one time or another at any restaurant establishment.  Employees at this establishment come and go. Waiters, bartenders, hostesses those inexperienced individuals may be underwhelming but for those who work here and are long time employees you can guarantee you will have an amazing experience! Some of the best service of dining I have received here The food is impeccable, and the place is very busy for a reason!  This place is GOLD.

Mike the GM is so rude. As a host he's extremely  rude and impatient.  It reflects in staff as well because they follow his example of being rude. He was short and very mean on a class trip that I went on with my students and he was also this way on sunday evening. The food is great but the service sucks.

So I recently moved from Florida and I usually went to the cpk over there and I would get the jamaican jerk chicken pizza. It usually is delicious and we'll seasoned. So I decided to go to this 1 in queens, ny. However I was extremely disappointed. The drink was ehhh the jerk chicken pizza was not really good. The chicken wasn't seasoned well at all. It looked like they just slapped the chicken on top. This will be useless but my fiance ordered something and didn't like and had to switch out the order. Needless to say we were highly disappointed.

I ate here with familyfor the first time , and the farmers market soup is definitely my new winter of addiction. The spinach dip with the chips are so delicious that you just cannot stop eating them and you feel like asking for more. They also serve avocado rolls which are fried and I'm not a fan of fried food because it's not healthy but I did try a piece and it was really good everything that they served with amazing my boyfriend had the steak and the presentation was beautiful and the tasty was phenomenal keep up the good work California pizza kitchen

Pretty unhappy with the service. Asked several times for grated cheese for my daughter. Also asked for marinara sauce. The sauce was brought straight from the fridge. When I asked for cheese again I was scolded since she wasn't my waitress. Just wanted to spend time at lunch with my child. Hostess seemed stressed with phone calls and people coming in. When asked if everything was OK, the waitress did not wait for my response. Last time I come.

I am a teachers assistant and went on the trip last week. There were 5 classes from my school, we are talking about 170 kids.  It was very well organized! Kids had a blast!  Dough and toppings were already prepared, so as soon as kids were done assembling their pizza , staff took it to bake and we went to the kitchen and fridge for a tour.  Kids ate pizza and then ice cream and we were done !    Many happy smiles !

OK so I've been to this place a few times before i came a "yelper" lol lol, so now i have the responsibility to write a review lol. Went here on a Sunday night with my GF while waiting for a movie, it was convenient so we decided to go for it.. i haven't been here in a while so i was like ok wth why not, i usually don't like to eat in commercial restaurants but this time i have to make an exception when i say i have to is because my GF made me hahaha.. anyways, the place pack as usual, service slow, we had to different waiters which made confusing for us when asking for help. i asked for the avocado club egg rolls ! and my GF ordered the quinoa + arugula salad and as entree we ordered the California club pizza, thin crust . all the food came except the egg rolls which come to find out after i enquired that they have ran out of avocados! oh i also ordered the white sangria !! the food was decent the service was OK, the waiter Mauricio was excellent it seems as he was picking up the slack from the other waiters. if you waiting for a movie and are hungry definitely come to this place .. i will come back here just for the SANGRIA!! holy molly i had three glasses.. their sangria has always being good !!! cheers !

This CPK location is terrible.  There were 3 of us total and we actually got seated fairly quickly (within 10 minutes) even though the place looked packed. 1 star for that. We got a menu that actually had food inside of it and when asked for another, a waitress took it away with attitude as if we had placed the food in the menu.  It took the waiter forever to come introduce himself. It took him long enough for us to decide what drinks and food we wanted to order. We had a feeling it'd take forever to get his attention so we wanted to order it all in one shot. We ordered our drinks and then the food ordering came.... I got the salmon - fine, all good there. One person wanted the ribeye which we were told was out. Another wanted the chicken... Again... Out. Then they both tried to order a pasta dish..all seemed fine and then we found out there was no more fettuccini... And if you know their menu, practically every pasta dish is fettuccini based. One eventually settles for penne noodles (they end up giving spaghetti) and another settled for fish (which was of course dry). It took about 45mins to get the food. Throughout the meal, the waiter hardly checked in on us. A friend kept feeling something drip down on her and she didn't realize it was water of some sort dripping from the ceiling. We told the waitress behind us at the cash register (same one with the attitude from the menu incident) and she just rudely says "I don't see anything." And when my friend says that she can still feel it, the waitress brushes it off and just says "okay i'll tell someone." We end up telling our own waiter and his reply was "I don't see how anything could be dripping from there. Maybe it's the AC then." I mean we were just giving them a heads up and they were genuinely pissed off that we were doing so. In short, I'll never go back again. It takes a lot to piss me off to the point of not giving a tip to the guy. I usually at least give something, but this time I opted to give the money to charity instead of putting it on the tip line. Awful service here.

I would maybe give them more stars because food is usually good but I ordered online. Was told it would be ready at 7:41 and it is now 8:17 and I am just getting my food. Not really a small time error. 36 mins late is unacceptable... the entire amount of time from order to pick up was 59 mins for 2 pizzas and 2 apps. Sad

The worst CPK experience I have ever had! Food was gross - lemonade was warm (no ice), the salad was soggy and partially frozen, the pasta was dry and tasteless and the food for our kids came out 10 minutes after the grown up food. The only upside to the meal was not having to pay for the disgusting salad.

So So food...ordered Jambalaya Fettuccine...pasta was barely cooked....drinks are good.  Service is slow..waiter only checked on us once throughout dinner....better service is needed in this restaurant.

This place has to be one of the best in the Glendale area!   To start the spinach dip is fresh and warm !    The margaritas are extremely popular,  And the service is one of a kind by a unique and friendly bartender/server. Ask for Mauricio  This is definitely a to go place

Great pizza, pasta and salads (in terms of variety, healthy options, flavors, and allergy awareness). A great place to take a large/small group of any age. Kid friendly food options. Quick, friendly service and teamwork. (Beverage service still needs work, but otherwise it's a local family favorite.) I wanted to take before and after photos, but the gang feasted faster than I could grab the camera, haha. Look up the following on their menu: Spinach Artichoke Flatbread Pizza w/ Chicken Tequila Fettuccini  Moroccan Chicken Salad Chipotle Chicken Pizza All recipes/ingredients and caloric information is available online for those with allergies and special dietary needs.

Mediocre food coupled with mediocre service.  Fettuccini Alfredo sauce lacked flavor, and the artichoke dip was oily and bland. It was not a busy night yet the waitress seemed in a rush to take our order, she barely gave us a minute to look over the menu. Will not be returning.

Came here for a quick bite and got the spinach artichoke dip with the Sicilian thin crust pizza for two. The pizza had a nice spice to it . The only thing the dough was a tiny bit rough. It has sausages and pepperonis with some other stuff on it. It was great and we both enjoyed it: overall it was good and affordable.

California Pizza Kitchen really deserves 3.5 stars. My best friend and I stopped by for lunch this past week. We enjoyed the outside seating since it was such a gorgeous day. Unfortunately, there were some patio umbrellas that were improperly secured that almost fell on us several times. It was partly super funny but partly annoying having to be afraid an umbrella would fall on us during our meal. The manager and another worker eventually came out to fix the umbrellas so that made us feel slightly better even though they were unsuccessful. It felt like we were on an episode of Candid Camera.  Nonetheless, I really enjoyed the food. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip as an appetizer. It was slightly runny but had decent flavor. I ordered the lunch combo with the BBQ chicken pizza with a Mediterranean salad. Everything was very delicious. The service was super friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend this place to others and return if in the area.

I really enjoyed my lunch here. The atmosphere is welcoming and the entire place has a really nice look. It's a lot bigger than I had anticipated. It was a bit crowded bit we did not have to wait long at all (less than 10 minutes). Our waitress was timely and the food was really delicious. I ordered the potato soup and a margarita pizza and both were great. We ordered a couple of drinks and they did not skimp on the alcohol! There is a bar area in the restaurant and they allow for big parties. The music levels were just right and the lightening was not too bright or too low. I'd say the prices are pretty modest; slightly higher than your typical NY pizzeria but not as pricey as an expensive Italian restaurant in Manhattan. Overall, my opinion of California Pizza Kitchen is high and I cannot wait to go back again.

I been here a few times always pretty good service and the food is always good. I love that they have an outside dinning area for the summer time. 4 stars because every time I go there's always a wait but other then that great place.

a good cali pizza kitchen to visit when at the atlas park mall. it's kinda hidden next to starbucks but sometimes when you walk around a mall you usually find a place that fits your need and i have the need to enjoy some artisan brick oven pizza. the place is really nice inside as you enter the hostess greets you at wine/plant counter and you have a choice of a booth , table , or a stool at the bar which is the way to go if it's crowded or you happen to be flying solo. i will not be that fool who sits alone at a booth or table with a book, no way jose it's straight to the bar area for me. i was greeted by the lovely bartender gal and handed a menu right away . the bar area is a long curved area with plenty of comfy stools and a large tv showing a college basketball game and you are up close to the pizza oven so you can watch your food being prepared and made . the menu is extensive with assorted flatbread bites , apps of artichoke dips, tex mex rolls, spicy dumplings, salads , soups, pasta, chicken, fish dishes , etc and of course the pizza which is the main reason to visit. i ordered the sesame  chicken dumplings as my app and glad i did 6 pieces to a plate and very tasty . my next pick was easy the orginal barbecue chicken well done easy on the sauce and it's a done deal . the pizza is really good and it helps that each pizza is made per order so freshness is a guarantee .for dessert i dont have to look at the menu cause it's key lime pie which is yummy delicious . the lunch time menu  is a small pizza with soup or salad combo along with a few other smaller lunch time plate deals. the bartender always made sure my glass of diet coke was filled and came around often to check up on me. this location is bigger then the one in scarsdale and less crowded and the pics along the walls is a mix of california and new york style. overall i enjoyed my visit , food and service gets 4. 5 stars and i will be back soon to try some other menu options .
This place is solid...Clean, good food and convenient if your already in Atlas..Enjoyed my food each time ive been there..

Food is good but the service is horrible the waitress was rude we were sitting here for 20 min when it was lunch time not very busy either. I will think about it twice coming to eat here when I'm hungry

I've never had any bad experiences in this place. Always spoke great about this place and always looked forward to coming here. We had just finished watching a movie and then came into the restaurant; it looked like it had been under new management. We got seated by the manager Mike himself. My girlfriend and I waited a whopping 15-17 mins and no waiter came to us. I'm a patient person but what upset me the most was that Mike the manager, himself, was taking orders from tables that got seated way after we got seated, yet, didn't care about us. We left displeased with the restaurant. Idk if I would go as far as to say never go to this place, but I was very unhappy with the long wait after being seated. Maybe Mike needs some management as well. Btw we left without eating.

So some friends and I went in and there was no server. They saw us and ignored us for about 5 minutes...and the rest of the evening went downhill from there... We ordered our drinks (no ice for me) and our food. We got our drinks (mine with ice...not that big of a deal) and our food came a lot later. We had no silverware or napkins. After unsuccessfully waving at the waitstaff and staring at them in desperate attempts to get some service, we managed to track one down and beg for utensils; 15 minutes later we got some.  The food was good, yet they left the shrimp tails on in the pasta which is usually not normal anywhere but whatever, at least we wouldn't be eating with our hands right...  My boyfriend and I went with another couple who each had a birthday. We snuck out earlier to request dessert for the bday folks after our food. Apparently that meant to leave us in limbo waiting for a half hour. After seeing our waitress skip out on the tables to play bartender for 20 minutes, we realized she was not coming back and we were left alone to our defenses yet again. We canceled dessert, paid and walked out. We opted for the better service at Coldstone down the block.  Moral of the story- thanks for ruining a decent evening with your shitty service CPK. My friend is leaving for a few years and we wanted a laid back bday dinner before they left. The food was decent, but the service was so atrocious we won't be coming back. This place could learn a lesson in service from McDonalds and that's just sad.

Got sick. Heartburn started about one hour after eating and then was up all night with my stomach churning. CPK was the only thing I ate that day. The food itself was very basic standard chain restaurant pizza. My guess would be that something isn't being handled properly in their kitchen.

What like is the thai crunch salad their sauce is so delicious and it was so refreshing...we ordered 2 kinds of pizza 1.thai chicken pizza and the original bbq pizza for me both of them taste bland maybe I expected too much...coming from NY I still love NY pizza. Maybe next time will try different course when we go here.
I came here for lunch during the week and I got so much attention from staff, the pizza and drinks were top notch, and they sat little 'ol me in a booth, all to myself. felt like a Queen!

Hanging out with the bestie means I have limited choices of food when it comes to lunch or dinner time. It's either Vietnamese, Filipino or Italian food for us.  CPK is located inside Atlas mall. A great outdoor mall but most of the time overlooked. If there is anything that has always been here since I started coming, it's the theatre, Simply Fondue, Starbucks and this place. It was packed on a Saturday afternoon, no wonder it stayed open. We were  promptly seated as soon as we got there. Apparently, everyone else waiting outside wanted booth seating. Hmmmm...more space for me then. We ordered two small plates, a white corn guacamole with chips and spicy fennel sausage with pepper flat bread. I cannot quite remember but I believe they were both under $5 if not a little more. Guacamole was fresh and the white corn made great sense as my taste bufs loves it. The flat bread was also great and could definitely take the place of the thin crust pizza. For our main dishes, we shared Hawaiian thin crust pizza (besties fave) and Pesto Penne with shrimp. Pizza was alright. Sweet pineapple and ham always a good combo. I've always gotten their BLT pizza since I first tried it back in the day, a slight deviation from my norm but didn't hurt a bit. Pasta dish was creamy, the penne does look like it wasn't fresh and may have come from dry boxed pasta but it was cooked perfectly. CPK is a food chain that somehow kept it's quality of food and service, IMO. I'd most likely come back again.
This place is smh.  The place looks pretty and the service is great.  I just didn't like the food or libations!

Once again, they proved why they will remain my first choice. Clean, wide, enough room so each table will have the privacy every meal should include.  But I think that the service here is above all. I never had a problem, so I do not know how they would handle a complain, but with the nicest waitress who served us, it is a place worth my updated review!

I went to CPK the other night before my bday. I had the 5 cheese pizza which was everything that was ever missing from my life.  The drinks were perfect, not weak at all. They will creep up on u they are so perfect.  The wait staff was so friendly and warm. It wasn't crowded since it was a Monday night but by enjoyed the peace and quiet just the same. The restaurant was immaculate.  I am actually headed there now to get some more pizzaaaaa! This will definitely be a regular spot for me.

I'd honestly like to give ZERO STARS to this CPK location. We (party of 3) came to have dinner and we were seated right away. It seemed like a slow, Thursday night so we were looking forward to a nice quiet dinner. There were two other tables in our section that the waitress was walking back and forth to, us being just between the two tables. She walked by us about 4 times and we didn't even get a "hello." After realizing that this waitress was ignoring us, we looked around for another employee to flag down or even just make eye contact with. We waited about 20 minutes and we were so frustrated and hungry that we left and walked to Chilli's and received fast and attentive service, what CPK should have provided. Bottom line: CPK was very disappointing and I'm not very motivated to come back.

Great concept. Decent food The price is a little bit high for something I expect for it to be small  I did like the red velvet cake. Very Tasty. Decent customer service. Could be better  Overall its ok. Will come back

The food and the place is amazing, the only problem I have with it is that it's too far from the subway station. The place is design for mostly people with car and who have plenty of time to take the bus, and since the place is on an outdoor mall, it's just perfect for summer. I doesn't fit for a manhattan person who is busy and don't have enough time to go out especially on this freezing climate. I'll come again once I get my summer vacation and when it's already warm outside, and hopefully I can bring more people with me!.!.

Hapoy St Pattys day with a Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza!!!  Yummo!!! I never have a complaint in this place, even if my pizza takes long to arrive, it's just a reminder that I will get to eat it freshly made!

The waitress was very friendly but the cooking was horrible.  It took forever for food to come out.  I asked for a medium rib eye and it came back well done and tough to chew on.  The chicken was so over cooked that there was a thick layer of dried out meat that was impossible to chew.  I don't know how the chef would have thought that was acceptable to serve.
I love it here! Margaritas will have you talkin funny!!  fish tacos probably are the best in the city

I love the atmosphere here at California pizza kitchen it's very lively. I enjoyed this location since it had opened I always came here with girlfriends to eat drink and laugh (very good for girls night out). Their food is a bit pricey but very worth it, I always stick to the pizza and my favorite is the Greek pizza it's so fresh and their is so many flavors that hit you at once, it's like a party in your mouth. They have outside seating in the spring summer and fall and it's very enjoyable to sit outside with a nice cold mimosa in the summer and relax and enjoy the surrounding views. I would recommend everyone to try this lovely place. If you have children no worries they have a kids menu for the little ones to enjoy.

This is one of those places that I'm glad I live near by, the food here is awesome never been let down by anything I've tried, the drinks are bomb nice and strong, Good service everyone's nice and attentive. They have alil menu called small plates they have stuff for like 5 bucks, I don't like Mac and cheese much but they have this fried Mac and cheese which are delicious and the spicy chicken tinga quesadilla. They have an small appetizer menu but it's really good, there sesame chicken dumplings and the avocado egg rolls smh off the hook. They have great pizzas and pastas never been disappointed every time I've been there always look forward to going back, a must try.

I have come here a couple times-- In the past with my friend before the movies for a drink-- and then never made it to the movies. The raspberry Lemon drop is amazing much try!  More recently i have also ate more then just the salad at CPK. They have great lettuce wraps on the appetizers and if you're just eating it don't get a second main course dish the wraps are filling. The pizza's that are most appealing to me are: Spicy Chipotle Chicken and Wild Mushroom. I also get a half salad since I love to top my pizza with the salad.  I did try the pasta one time and it wasn't to good so I stay away from that-- it's has Pizza in the name not Pasta.  The servers are at most time on point-- very nice all the time. And reasonable priced.
Great place to have dinner,  try to avoid the early evening crowd though people really don't know how to control their kids.
Service has always been good, the food is good, a nice cozy place to sit and enjoy with friend and family.

I really enjoy this place. The spinach and artichoke dip is so delicious. I also tried the chipotle pizza, the mushroom one, and the regular. The regular is my favorite. The red sangria is a must have its so delicious.
Great  customer service by Florjan who served us. He is very courteous. He should be acknowledged for how good he is in his dealings with customers

I never have to wait to be seated. The food Is always so fresh.  The manager is always so attentive. He makes sure you get bread & refills while you are waiting for you main dish.   Try their chicken piccata. I crave it every other day.
I went shopping in atlas mall with friends and we found this cute pizza spot.i loved the place.they have full bar and delicious food.

As soon as you enter the establishment, the hostess greets you with a fake smile and menial small talk, and doesn't seem friendly at all. However, the waitress we had was very nice. I ordered the California veggie pizza as part of the lunch special and specifically asked for no mushrooms. Of course, the pizza arrives and there are mushrooms in my pizza. Another 10/15 minutes of waiting and I get a sub-par pizza and a lackluster salad.

Went to CPK for the first time. We got seated quickly, I looked at the menu and decided what I wanted, my girlfriend knew what she wanted and we looked around the half empty restaurant for our waiter. There were none to be found. Not at other tables, not at the bar. No one came for drink orders. After more than 15 very hungry minutes we simply walked out. There was no one even at the host stand to complain to. Very disappointing.

i give CPK 4 stars only because my daughter is a fan. I like the convenience, after a movie you can grab a bite. The waiting area is pretty tight ..if seats are taken you would have to wait by door or outside The wait isn't too bad. maybe 20 min max. I noticed the menu had a few changes recently...the white pizza use to be my favorite ..now its gone, however, the artichoke four cheese wasn't bad at all,, overall its   hangout spot for family night.

I'm only giving this two stars because of the slow service I've been to this place many times before when it's busy and the service has been great. When I came here with my girlfriend there wasn't any hostess to take us to our table.  It wasn't that busy and there were three waitresses working in the entire establishment. We had to wait for a bit then finally someone came and got us a table. Then it took about 15 minutes for the waitress to come and take our drink orders. She took so long that we had already decided what we were going to order. We finished our entrees and yet again the waitress took 15 minutes to come by to ask if everything was ok, so I took advantage of this opportunity to order the desert. She took another 15 minutes to come by and bring us the check.  Overall the restaurant and food is good.
Still horrible service. ...tried to give a second chance but response time is just too slow.

This place is okay. I come here occasionally. Good quality really depends on what you order. The Moroccan Spiced Salad is one of my favorites, but last time I was here I ordered one of their "creations" that just tasted horrible (don't remember what it's called but it had shrimp, and zucchini in it and tasted bitter).

My bf and I came to the mall. We decided to try this pizza for the first time. My bf enjoyed the Cali pizza, which he also added some pasta on top of it. Everyone around us looked at him. I had chicken Alfredo with cheese on top. It tasted like home cooked Alfredo pasta. I'd rather some more chicken. Also, the chicken should be seasoned.  The service was very good, everyone was very friendly and inviting. Our waitress was very attentive to our needs and wants. Just the way I like it.  Desert was delicious, buttercake. Yummyy. It tasted like pound cake but richer.

Usually a fan of this place , went on a Monday afternoon with my family(6 of us) service was at its worst, server said I'm a busy so you might have to wait , and that we did !!!!! 15 min for drinks , no bread ( asked 3 x) no refills on drinks . And to really top things off bathrooms were disgusting and filthy , with no toilet paper

Went here a bunch of times. Clean, bright inviting decor, very family friendly. It's convenient with all the other shops and movie theaters.  The food was hit or miss. THe first time, the Chicken milanese was tender and tasty. THe second time, it was dry. Same with the salmon. And the pasta with cream sauces were bland, not enough cream for my liking, as I felt as if I was just eating pasta. But that depends on a person's preference.  Chicken avocado rolls are the best, by far my favorite dish so far.

Have enjoyed dining at many CPKs. This was not the case at the Atlas Mall today. We should have known when we walked in at 1pm and it was freezing inside the restaurant. When we commented to the hostess she said everyone was complaining and she didn't know if they were going to put the remedy the situation. She started taking our order because the waitress wasn't in yet. Didn't get bread for 30 minutes because they "ran out and had to send someone to get more". Not usual CPK quality. And we were freezing the entire time.

The food was delicious as usual. The waiter got the order right and the food came out quite fast. My only gripe was that i felt that they sat me in a spot that was kind of in the way then i observed them placing more tables and chairs in other inconvenient areas (for example right at the entrance of the kitchen)

Wow, it's been years since I've ate at CPK, and somehow it's even better than I remembered! The pizzas were good, but the salads are definitely better. I like the fact that the menu isn't limited and they offer healthy choices. Service is a bit mediocre.

I really want to like the shops at Atlas Park. And I've eaten here a few times since they opened but I want the management to read this carefully. If your "lunch" menu says 11-something for your mahi mahi fish tacos, don't put $14.95 for those Tacos on the check at the end of the meal. And don't have your otherwise good waitress tell me that it's because the prices changed! That's bull! And when I sent her back, she comes back 10 minutes later and says she the "manager" took 2.50 off the Bill as if it's a favor and then proceed to tell me that it's because the dish now serves up 3 tacos instead of 2! Again, BS!        Now, let's talk taco: dry, flavorless fish scooped out of some freezer, dry tortillas, shredded red cabbage that tasted like paper and a side of thrown together nachos as a side do not make for a passable dish! One taco, two tacos, or three, they all SUCKED. But because your waitress was nice I was just going to pay and go until you tried to sneak that higher price and terrible taco by me. The mango lemonade and the avocado (which she said should have been extra) was good. But thanks for an epic lunch failure. You barely have lunch business as it is... Good luck with that.

We used to go here every week. Never again.  On the last occasion we went for dinner, there was spit in one drink. The waiter denied it and said that the drinks come that way.   The manager saw it, confirmed that it looked like spit. He comped our meal, but that does not make up for this disgusting experience.  Be wary of CPK at the Atlas Park mall is all I can say.

had the asparagus and arugula salad and the bbq chicken pizza.  salad good.  pizza crust a little soft.  friendly service although a little slow.  i think our server had more tables than she could handle.  with er that or the kitchen was slow.

Been a fan of this chain for years. Was happy to find one close to my house. Can't go wrong with their spinach artichoke dip and BBQ chicken pizza. I also like their chicken Caesar salad sandwich. Service is usually pretty good. The one time it was a bit slow the manager comped us for an appetizer which was greatly appreciated. They have a bar but I have to take one star away for watered down, pre-made cocktails. If your gonna drink, stick with beer.

My wife and I used to dine at this location at least twice a month since we got married 7 years ago. This restaurant used to be the best place to eat before enjoying a move at the theater nearby. In recent months they changed their menu, they took out popular items like the Tricolore salad and replaced their signature seasoned focaccia (herb cheese) with a cheap alternative. We had a terrible experience recently. our dishes did not come out at the same time, and to "make up" for it; the manager came over and started to literally push a plate of something different in front of us despite our efforts to tell him we did not wish to eat that. Its a sad thing seeing a restaurant you used to love turn into a place where you would never eat again, hopefully they will realize what is happening and make some changes soon.

I'm so happy that there is a cpk close to home. I'm from Boston and apparently chain restaurants are taboo in NYC. I was so thrilled to see a piece of home here. I always get the chicken piccata but everything is great as well. I love that the Mac and cheese for kids are made fresh and not from the box. My kids love it and so do I! This was our first time coming since we've moved to NYC and it was a great experience. We say outside and enjoyed our meal to live music playing in the green. Our server was exceptional, and I feel bad I forgot her name but I forget everything. Remember to sign up for rewards, you earn a free small plate!
The food was good, but they need to replace their sticky menu. It was disgusting. Otherwise, I would give them a four star.

Passed this CPK after going to Simply Fondue's and we decided to try this place out.  Fairly quick service here and the food was quite good. It could be my new favorite chain before TGIFriday's.  The lemon chicken pasta was so delicious! I'm a big lover of lemon-flavored anything so this was a yummy choice. Boyfriend got the meat lovers pizza which was good too. As appetizers we got the fried mac & cheese and the Korean bbq tacos. I had really high hopes for the mac & cheese but it wasn't anything spectacular. The Korean bbq tacos had a spicy kick to it that I would totally go for again. Ended the night with a chocolate brownie with ice cream.. the brownie wasn't soft! I thought I would break the spoon eating it. Srsly.

Came here with my girlfriend on a Monday evening. We were seated by a very bored, uninterested, preoccupied teenager who must have been practicing her best robot impersonation.  She commanded: "Two? Sit. Enjoy."  So we sat, went over the menu, and waited... and waited... and waited...  20 minutes pass and we've pretty much memorized the menu. We were hungry. But there was no server or waitress in sight. Since being seated, no one else had come to help us. No waters, no silverware, not even a little cocktail napkin to place drinks on. Did they forget us? It wasn't like we were hard to find; we were smack dab in the middle of the restaurant floor. And it wasn't exactly a busy night, either. We looked around and notice all of the unhappy faces juxtaposed on the other customers. Some were visibly annoyed waiting to order, and others had finished eating before we had even arrived and sat awkwardly, waiting for the check.  In other words: service was slower than slow. A couple near us left a booth seat, so we asked the busboy wiping it down if we could switch to the booth. As he was just the busboy and had no real pull in the restaurant, he goes to relay our message to the uninterested teenage robot.  She doesn't say a word to us, but speaks only to the busboy in Spanish. Thanks to my 8th grade Spanish skills, I overheard her mention that she wanted to reserve the booth for parties of more than 2 people. So the busboy comes and tells us no. Not 5 minutes later, she seats a party of 2 in that very same seat. Having wasted a half hour of our time to be completely ignored, we left. And that's okay, because this is New York City; you don't need to go to some national strip-mall chain restaurant for good food.

The jerk chicken pizza is really good.. It had bacon peppers onions and all kinds of veggies.. I will come back again.. The only negative thing going on in this place is the rude old white lady.. Not sure what her problem was but she needs a (chill pill) lol...

VERY UPSET AND NEVER COMING BACK!! This is my first time rating on YELP, and i felt that i needed to express my unsatisfying experience at CPK. On Sunday, March 27, 2016 my boyfriend and I were at Atlas Mall, and were hungry; so we decided to try CPK for the first time. We get there and my boyfriend gives the hostess his name. We proceed to wait for about 10 mins, and we noticed that a couple that walked in after us was seated. At first we thought nothing of it, until 3 minutes later another couple that came in after us was seated as well! So, my boyfriend and I were very upset, and he goes up to the hostess and asks her why were these people that came in after us were seated, and when she asked him for his name; my boyfriend sees his name crossed out! He tells her that's his name and its crossed out, meanwhile we're still waiting. HER explanation was that some other hostess must of called him, and sat another couple who pretended to be us down. HOLD ON! so you mean to tell me that outside of her being there, there is someone else sitting other people down. Never have i been to a restaurant where there are up to THREE or more people sitting customers down. SO, i we were very upset about that. So, we would assumed that the next table that was available would be given to us... NOPE, three more groups that came in after us was seated down.  We also asked for a table not next to the door, because that day was very chilly and i wasn't feeling well. When they do call us, they sit us by the door. So my boyfriend asks if we can sit somewhere else thats not by the door, and she said she couldn't, and if we want another table we have to wait another 10 mins! Meanwhile, i saw 3 open booths by the window emptied. That made me even more upset... to top it off i saw another couple that was sitting two tables down from us that was seated before us even though they got to the restaurant after us, were moved to one of the empty booths that i saw earlier. FYI the hostess told my boyfriend that they were the couple that were seated under our name by the other hostess!!! SO you mean to tell me that they were getting better treatment than us; after they pretended to be someone else! VERY UPSET!! Just to wrap it off the STRAWBERRY LEMONADE, THE ORIGINAL LEMONADE DID NOT TASTE GOOD, AND WHEN I ASKED FOR A SPRITE. THERE WASNT ANY LEFT. I got a coke instead... THE SPINACH ARTICHOKE DIP HAD NO FLAVOR AND THE CHIPS WERE STALE.  The only thing that saved the place the the semi-good pizza. My boyfriend asked for crispy crust, and it was was soggy and falling apart. AND our waiter BRIAN EUGENE, his service was great! Even after changing my drink more than once, he did not make us feel like a bother  ((P.S. he didn't charge for our drinks)). He made us actually feel like customers who mattered, unlike the hostess'. Thank You for your service Brian!! But sadly, we will not be returning to the restaurant. I really hope they read this and take notice of what is going on.
Was here a few days ago for some drinks. Drinks were delicious and the bartender Ashley is just amazing and perfect. Loved it, will be back soon.

This is my 3rd visits here with years apart.  It's a place that we always knew about the this place but it's never a really have as a 1st choice. Today for appetizer we had one of the new item on the appetizer menu; the bianco flatbread. I like it was good for drinks I had the passion fruit mojito but I wasn't crazy about after drinking 1/3 I decide to stop drinking. For our entree I ordered the garlic parmesan fetticinni w/ shrimp. This plate was good the shrimp were he freshest I've ever had in restaurant setting. My date had gluten free Hawaiian pizza but that was definitely a waste of money. I've had gluten free food and never taste so unflavored before. With all that said and done it explains why we've only been here 3 times.

I recently visited this location as I am a big fan of this chain.  The pizza was terrific as always however the service from start to finish was something to be desired.  I had to repeat how many guests we were 4 times to be seated.  Then our waiter was terrible.  He messed up our orders and would serve the wrong order bc he didn't what each of us ordered or didn't care.  To boot he asked us to help him to pass him all the dirty plates.  The service felt as if the point if eating out was missed when you have to help clear the table!  To make matters worse and the icing in the cake was the bill.  We wanted to split the bill however I was charged twice.  My I told the server he had an attitude and said this wasn't possible. He went and corrected the situation however at the same time overcharging my card again. When I called over a manager he came over initially very compative and argumentative.  He again when's to correct the overcharge however it's still on my credit card.  There were no apologies by the staff during this situation and instead only discomfort. I highly discourage going to this location.
A chain is a chain is a chain. No difference wherever they are located. If you like this type of institutional food then it's for you. If not there are enough pizza joints to visit in the City!
I am gluten intolerant and this is the only place I have found that makes the pizza fresh for you.   Loved the gluten free pizza and my kids loved it as well

I give this place one star. Terrible service!!! When we sat we didn't get menus. We got our menus 10 minutes later...our drinks arrived 20 minutes after we ordered them, we ordered two appetizers and only got one,  the pizza we ordered took forever to arrive, the food was ok nothing special, but didn't. Expect something better.  Overall the service was the worst part!!!!

Simply amazing. We waited five minutes while the manager went into the back room to give me a free kids meal coupon because everyone here is such a nice person and a passionate worker. It's rare to find such customer service and quality food these days especially in a chain restaurant such as California pizza kitchen

I love me some CPK. All the unique pizzas are great. Had the Jamaican jerk pizza which they now have on thin crust and it was amazing. Really friendly staff and lively atmosphere. The avocado rolls were incredible as well. Can't go wrong here.
Ordered three pies, pepperoni, roasted garlic and the BBQ chicken.  All three were delicious.  Service was excellent (thank you amber!) And very attentive.

Came here today for Valentine's Day dinner with my girlfriend and even though it was a very busy night, we were seated almost immediately by a very welcoming waitress. We ordered the $30 Valentine's Day meal which included an appetizer, two entrees and a dessert. For the appetizer we chose the Spinach Artichoke Dip which was amazing. The portion was more than enough for the both of us and the dip was savory to the last bite. We also ordered a Mango-Raspberry Colada to go with our meal and this is WELL WORTH the $4.50. Usually, I am not a big fan of spending so much for a drink. I mean, why spend 5 bucks on a drink when I can get an entire box of Halal?? But I have to say, this drink was Delicious. Amazing. And Pure Joy to Drink. Need I say more? For the entrees, I ordered the Five Cheese Pizza (based on the reviews on Yelp) while my girlfriend ordered the KungPao Spaghetti. The pizza was amazing. The blend of different cheeses melting in your mouth makes you never want to stop eating. And the KungPao Spaghetti provided a unique blend of Asian and American flavor to the table.
