For the dessert, we got the Belgian Chocolate Souffle which was tasty but nothing too special. Overall, I think this place did an amazing job in serving their customers. The food was great, and they have great staffs. The people there are extremely friendly and they genuinely care about your experience there. If you ever get a chance to be around the area, I implore you to go eat there!!!

I like the bar area set-up.   Points for that...   There is a large dining space, with out door seating.......... As for the menu, there's lot too choose from....  Ithink I noticed about 30 different pizzas, salads, pastas, etc........ I choose a thin crust artichoke and spinach pizza.  I liked the crust, but that's about it.....  Honestly, I wish I ordered a salad.  The salads look really good.   They have a large wine list,  And they will serve half a glass (3oz), or a full glass.  I liked the fact that the Santa Margarita was only $30. per bottle....  That is only an $8.00 markup.  I usually see it priced at $40-50. at most restaurants.  I was here around 12 noon, children were seated at almost every table!  Lot's of noise, screaming, staring children.......... I guess this is the place to be, if you want to take your children and meet a friend who also wants to dine out with their children.......  I'm not necesarily saying thats a bad thing, it's just not a place I prefer to be...... Or,  if you happen to work in the area, you might consider getting a  take out salad....
Have been to this Restaurant 3 times....Good and varied food at good prices....Great service...

Just had the weirdest experience. CPK, I love you but I don't know what happened. My table ordered two salads. One came with way too much dressing. The other came with barely any. Figured I'd bring mine home and add some dressing from my fridge and eat it later. Before I could tell the waitress my request she had the dirty bottom of the other dish in my salad. I usually have a great experience at CPK restaurants across America, but I guess I was just fell victim of too many careless decisions at this location. PS: I'm nervous to complain to management and send food back.

I really wish I could give these guys a better rating but i'm giving them a 3 because although the service is pretty good the food is so-so. I know these guys pride themselves on be edgy when it comes to their pizza but you what, some of their combo's are just to over the edge and taste strange.  "Not in a good way" Appi's here are pretty good though and straight forward. I have never tried anything else here before so maybe next time i'm at one i'll try something else other then pizza out.

Yea food is still the same. But this time around service loads better. Teresa our server was fantastic and friendly. Along with how fast the food came out and nice portions , I'll be coming back often.
Had a nice time here with a good friend of mine, The food was good and the service was even better. A little pricey but a great spot after a few hours of shopping at the Mall.

I've been here plenty of times and love this place. I am not rating the food because the food is wonderful.   However, today, service was slow.  I got there at 2:30 and didn't leave until 4.  My sister and I knew what we wanted and ordered 2 Five Cheese pizzas.  And we waited, and waited and waited. Our waitress never came to us.  Some guy did, not sure if he was the manager, and apologized about the long wait.  Finally, our pizza came, we ate and then we waited and waited and waited.  Our waitress never came.  We were going to order dessert after dinner but because of the lousy service, we decided not to.  The guy came by again.  I asked him to please get the waitress so we can pay.  I was going to complain but he walked away.  Although I enjoy their food, I won't be going back for awhile.
Had a fantastic dinner last night at cpk with an awesome waiter. I just wish parking was closer.

This is the second time that this place has messed up my take-out order.  The first time I ordered online and they messed it up so I thought I would call in to make sure that they get everything correct.  The girl who took my order over the phone was the worst.  I ordered two sandwiches with side salads and specified that there could not be any cheese on anything and the bread had to be traditional opposed to cheese.  It took her a very long time to get the order down but she repeated it back to me and thought I was all set.  I had my fiance go in to pick up the food and make sure that they didn't mess up.  Well....they messed up EVERYTHING.  Both sandwiches were on cheese bread and the salads had cheese as well.  When it was brought up to the same girl that took the order, she said there were no comments on the order but SHE TOOK THE ORDER!  I cannot believe how incompetent people are, how do they even keep their job?

i always seem to have mixed experiences when coming here. The food is always great but the service is a hit or miss. Here are a few positive & negative experiences: About 9 months ago i came with my girl friend & her daughter. We wanted a simple lunch because her daughter is young and we didnt want to hang out too long but the food took about an hour to come out, it was cold, and management didnt do anything for us. However we came here for my boyfriends cousins birthday with a group of about 10. The service was great along with the food so A+ on that. But I came a few days ago at 9:28pm and the girl at the front (who i actually knew from high school) told me they couldnt seat us because they stop seating at 9:30pm. I was a bit confused but then the manager gladly sat us down which was great!! Overall i'd say this place is a hit or miss on customer service but the food is always good if you're willing to look past the employees.

Its great to have as an option in the neighborhood and is usually less crowded then their competitors in the area. The good: the appetizers, the desserts and the drinks. The bad: its a chain place that can be hit or miss depending on the day, they recently had a B (which can be for a variety of reasons but still) sometimes the utensils need to be cleaned a little more.

Came here for my sister's birthday (11/3/2012) and it was my first time going here. I must say the pizza was amazing! I don't know what kind of dough they use for the crust (I had the three cheese & tomato pizza - slammin!) but it was to die for! We had the panko breaded mac & cheese for appetizers - OMG! Little bites of cheesy heaven hiding in panko bread! Who knew it would taste so good! At least if you're into fried foods - lol! Drinks were good, we had a passion fruit mojito and a cosmopolitan (can't decide which drink was better!) Waiting staff was pretty good overall and not as snobby as you think they would be for being in Atlas Mall. I definitely recommend this place for people trying to get some good pizza around the Woodhaven/Glendale area if you want a restaurant feel to some pretty good pizza. :)
Okay this is a great place for kids! The MacNCheese is simply yummy but the pizza there is horrible. Also very slow service! Not very clean.

I've been eating here occasionally for years; Restaurant is clean, wait staff are pleasant, food is consistently not bad. I live around the corner and once in a while will order for pick up but the food is NEVER ready by the time they specify it will be, usually arriving 15 minutes after its "available by" time but sometimes a lot longer. Order ahead.

The service was good in the beginning; i was seated right away and my order was taken. But then my appetizer took more than 15 min, and my entree even longer. The pasta dish was cold and when I asked it to be reheated, they packed it instead. I asked to put it back on a dish, warm of course.  It took them 10 min to get our card payment, so I had to flag down the manager to process our card. I tipped $5 on a $50 bill because the service was horrible.

OMG I loveeee this place. All I've ever had in the past was the Shrimp scampi pizza, avacado spring rolls appetizer, and totrilla soup.  For some reason this is like literally one of my favorite type of pizzas, and furthermore restaurants.  I wish they had a location that was a little more convenient. They have soooo many delicious flavors of pizza to choose from. I can't wait to go back and try more!

Came here before a movie. We were seated quickly by the hostess and our waitress Karen came over and quickly took our orders. We're very efficient when it comes to ordering. I ordered the BBQ Chicken Hawaiian pizza, as a throwback to my bacon and pineapple Domino days, and was disappointed to find a more than copious amount of red onions on the pizza. Now I don't mind red onions, but it seemed they were using the onions to replace either pineapple or chunks of chicken. What was worse was my girlfriend's pasta was supposed to have grilled chicken in it, but the chicken was boiled and not grilled. Worst part? I actually wanted dessert this time... and I had to get my own dessert menu. It's not like the place was packed or humming, so why it took so long to come when we were done... no idea. It definitely could have been better.

Terrible service. Had bad service last time, this time decided to document the experience.  Waited to be seated, finally the hostess begins to seat us, phone rings, instead of answering and asking for the person to hold so she can seat us she gets into a 5 minute convo. Then seats us, we ask for a high chair for baby, never brings it at all. Randomly walks by 10 minutes later and says "oh you needed a high chair right?." We also asked for bread for baby.... just never brought it and of course brought it with the food... Just terrible service. Never coming back.

TRULY TERRIBLE SERVICE.  At first, my kids used to enjoy the food here, but out of the 8-10 times we ate here, service was slow to downright neglectful more than half the time. I have worked in the service industry and I always try to give people the benefit of the doubt, but without exaggeration, we had to wait just shy of 40 mins for dessert once, and had to wait close to that for food on two other occasions. The final straw was when the last time a manager or assistant manager was waiting on us and the food came out very sporadically. My daughter had to wait 10 mins for her meal, and they brought out the three other meals several mins apart in the mean time. Then I had to literally walk around the restaurant trying to find someone to get us dessert and pay the bill. So disorganized!!  Today (several months later) we decided to give them one more chance and used their website's "curbside pick up". I was SHOCKED at the ineptitude of this service. I had a pick up time scheduled for 6:39pm. I arrived a few mins after that and called. No answer for 3 full mins of ringing. After a few more minutes, my friend went in, only to be told they had JUST put our food in the oven. (Now 10 mins AFTER my pick up time.) When he asked where I could wait since there was no place to stop for curbside pickup, the very rude woman shrugged her shoulders. He asked when it would be ready and she shrugged again. So I ended up circling this crowded mall parking lot for over TWENTY FIVE MINUTES, the whole time trying to call a manager who never picks up. Exactly 30 mins after my pick up time I parked and went in to find they were FINALLY  packing up my food and didn't seem the least bit concerned that I had been waiting so long. I finally got to see the managerial, who mumbled something about being busy and offered a very insincere, "we apologize for any inconvenience, but we are busy." My kids even agreed this time that their pizza is mediocre at best. I highly recommend finding a good local place, because those who run this restaurant truly DO NOT CARE about how they treat their customers.

Went to CPK earlier today (labor day) and where do i start ( deep breath ) my family and i arrive at CPK we are a party of 7 so understandably we know we have to wait, we tell the hostess we are a party of 7 she looks at us like we have 10 heads and asked us if we wanted to squeeze into a table obviously we did not we decided to wait... It was pretty empty so we figured it wouldnt be to long a party of 6 comes in and two tables were pushed together for them dont understand why that couldnt be done for us but ok... We sit order appetizers and drinks and order our meals 1 kids pizza, 1 kids pasta, 2 pizzas and 3 meals.... The food took forever to come out and it was cold like it was sitting out for awhile... The pizzas over cooked and dry, the pasta was hard like it wasnt cooked at all, AND MY BIGGEST PROBLEM was we ordered a kids fusilli ( curly pasta) with meat sauce what we got was SPAGHETTI with meat sauce and when they brought the pasta out we were told "oh we have the fusilli if you want we will bring it" OBVIOUSLY THATS WHAT WE ORDERED.... Instead of asking us if spaghetti was ok they brought it over regardless... Have you ever seen a 2 year old eating spaghetti they make a mess... So many other problems that i can safely say WE WILL NOT BE RETURNING!!!!

SALTY.  Food was very salty.  It was a great place to go with friends and if you have kids, but the food is not the reason why you go to CPK.   I had the Jambalaya which was over salted. The wait staff was pretty friendly and they were very accommodating with our small child.  Overall, I would go back here again if in a pinch and needed to find a place to eat with a group.

Decent restaurant. Usually always a wait on the weekends, but not too bad. Service is somewhat on the slow side, but still not too bad. Pizza is a hit or miss, but when it's a hit, it really hits the spot, and when it's a miss, it still isn't even that bad. However. the fried macaroni and cheese is incredible.

Th service here is horrible. On a very quiet Tuesday evening, we had to wait ten minutes before anyone even bothered to come by to take our order. The food is below average and is very overpriced. The waiter is very pushy and makes hints to give in  a tip. The restaurant is not maintained well, its very dirty looking and dingy. The deserts tasted like they came out of a box and was simply overheated. The pizza was okay but it taste very cardboard like.

The only reason this place is getting Any stars is because the food is always good. Whether it's the pizza, apps, or entrees.  The service here is horrible!!! I have been here about 7 times, and at least 5 have been some of the worst service I have ever experienced. Waiters disappear for at least 20 minutes (this especially when there is hardly anyone around). And it's a different waiter every time. I usually catch them in the back talking to each other.  If you ever go there and want good service make sure you tell them your in a rush for a movie. This works.

I've been coming here since they first opened and for the most part I've had good experiences, except for a few rare occasions. However I came here tonight to celebrate my anniversary with my boyfriend and felt compelled to write a review. I've never experienced such great service from a waitress before. Valerie was great, our drinks were refilled without asking and at first they didn't get my pizza right and she made them take it back before it even hit the table, and took my boyfriends pizza back to keep it warm while they made me a new one. Overall it was one of the best experiences I've had here.

The first time I tried this place a few years bac it was amazing. We decided to go back with my husband last summer to try it out and were not even close to satisfied. The food was not cooed well at all. Our waiterr was also not very helpful & took way too long. We decided to give it one more go this past week because we were starving. The prices are ridicolously outrages, I paid 20$ for a small salad ontop what was suppose to be a pizza but was actually an overcooked circle of bread. On top of that the chicken was extreely burnt, Not happy at all WIll noot be visiting or recomending this location or any other.
Every time I visit, I'm impressed with the sweet service the servers provide.. Salad is delicious, Pizza is Yummy!
The chocolate souffle with ice cream is very good! The California club pizza on thin crust is also tasty.

First time being here!  Really nice decor, friendly waitstaff... Our server never brought a friend's drink, made such a big deal about how many waters to bring out (it's just water!!), never brought out the utensils... Apparently, the chef forgot to put sauce on my pasta.  Maybe it just wasn't my night.

Went here for lunch with my wife for the first time yesterday. Place was clean, and the service was very good. My wife enjoyed her sandwich and soup, and my "works" pizza was okay. Overall there is nothing here that I would be in a rush to go back for. I thought the prices were high for lunch as well. Won't be in a rush to go back

This location seems to be in line with rest of the chains all over. Same taste etc. I feel all CPK have nice bar areas. So its cool for drink before the movie starts across the street. I've tried the thai chicken pizza- ok for a different taste but you have to be feeling that peanut taste b4 hand. i''d say stick to traditions like the meat cravers etc. And try the jamaican jerk. I love their small cravings arugal salad. Its wonderful. All of the small cravings are decent. But wait don't get cute ...they will not hold you lol. the morroccan chicken salad is GREAT. If you have one person do a pizza and another do a salad and share. then you will make off great here. The manager was attentive, waiters may be slow, too many baby carraiges so romance might be out of the question.

Just had a great lunch there.  The vegetarian pizza was totally delicious and it did not take long.  Drinks were good and fair priced.  Only thing is a lot families go here and (at least today) there were two instances of screaming young children, but it didn't last long.  Parking outside on plaza level of the Atlas Park Mall (enter on 80th St or Cooper Ave) is just $1 for the first hour.  I am a lifelong New Yorker and I know good pizza, and they got it.

If there was a way to leave no stars I would.  Long day at work and drove by Atlas Park and thought what a great idea for takeout. BIG MISTAKE.  ordered the avocado..egg rolls, Caesar salad, mushroom pizza and some dessert. $42. Got the food and went home (only half mile). We took  the food out of the bag and not only was everything Cold but I think they took the egg rolls and pizza out of the refrigerator and forgot to reheat it.  That's how disgusting the food was.  Caesar salad is usually more than some shriveled lettuce and should have dressing. None!! So we immediately called the restaurant only to be transferred to take out that never picked up!  Can you imagine?  Now we're pissed and called again only to be transferred to possibly a manager but that was useless. After we told them our situation there was silence!! No apology, no comment just silence.  So I hung up.  Wish I had paid by credit card, at least we could have challenged the charge.  So being furious for lack of customer service and recourse we called the corporate offices. It took two days for them to return our call and promised that we would be contacted by the restaurant. Well it's two weeks and nothing.  I guess they do enough business not to care. Well everyone, I hope you read this  and ban this disgraceful place they call a restaurant. Don't waste your time or money.  McDonald's would do a better job.

I've had a good variety of the things on the menu at CPK.  I really like the food.  It's not a fine dining restaurant so the food is average.  its a nice casual place to eat.  I don't go there to order any traditional pizza in fear I will be disappointed.  They specialize in specialty pizzas and all the ones I have tried are really good.  Their spinach artichoke dip is good too, and I love their avocado egg rolls.  The pasta is pretty good too.  Its so close to my house its so convenient to go there or order pick up when I don't feel like cooking.

My husband and I come once a week-ish. We like the staff, we have our favorites that are great at what they do. I am a little bored with the menu and honestly I think some of the food is down right weird :/ I think they should have specials, like real restaurants, that change every few days. Also, during the week when it's slow they must have their worst staff on, cause it's SLOW. Slow service, good luck getting your water refilled and it could take 2 hours from start to finish. I like the decor and the quality of the food but the music is awful and please turn it down. Like having a seizure in a 2 star club. BUT Atlas Park has limited selections and if you don't want Chili's microwaved frozen foods you gotta eat here!
CPK has simply the best selection of pizzas.   But if you're having dessert.... You MUST have the butter cake with vanilla ice cream!   Worth the 5 star review !

I've been here several times and have pretty much no complaints.  Great food, nice atmosphere, nice value for your meals.  So far I've had almost all of their salads and almost all of their desserts- all of them are great. Pizzas are good but I think the pastas need a little improvement.  The only reason I knocked off a star is because the take out service doesn't process after a certain time which means you'll have to drive there in person to order and then wait.  Nevertheless, the best spot in the entire mall in my opinion.

This place does not deserve any star. I was just there few mins ago. I was there it was not impressive. Today it was really bad. We waited to be seated for 45 mins. After being seated we waited for two hours for our order and when it arrived my pizza was all burnt and my friend's order(pasta) looked and tasted like it was stale and smelt funny. Worst food. It was a waste of time and energy. This iwill be ourt last time going  there. We have been to many restaurants but this is the worst restaurant  experience. Thumbs down to food and restaurant experience.
Horrible hostess, slow service.  Portions were significantly decreased but prices increased.  Cocktails were overly sweet and very weak, pricey as well.  Will never go back again.
Okay updating because I went back and service was so much better.  Was seated promptly. Service was up to par.  Good Job!

I ate here for the first time ever this Friday evening. It was very busy. We were seated at a restaurant table that was situated close to the bar area, as such the music was extremely loud. I did not enjoy myself because I could not relax with my meal due to the music blasting. I asked the waitress to lower the music, but I do not think that they did. Everything was very chaotic. Everyone's food looked good, but my fish tacos were not- I am not one to send  a meal back but I couldn't eat it! The texture was not appealing, nor was the taste (I normally love fish tacos). The lime they served it with was so dry I couldn't squeeze a drop of juice out of it. I only ate one of the three tacos on my plate and it contained the stem of the avocado inside- yuck! Fortunately, the manager was really great. He said he wanted me to be satisfied and took it away. He didn't charge me. I would eat here again, if I could sit at a table far away from the loud music and I'd try a different menu item. Stay away from the fish tacos!

The two huge square light fixtures are my favorite part of this location. When the California Club pizza came out covered in lettuce and avocado, too much green, I thought and not enough bacon and chicken. But once I dug in, the pieces of chicken and bacon were baked right into the crust. A club sandwich in pizza form!  Good service, the staff is well experienced. Sometimes it takes longer for orders to come out if there's a lot going on. Small square canvas paintings of avocados, seasonings, and pizzas are covered by glass on the wall. There is also a little seating area outside by Starbucks. They play some hip and happenin' music. Maybe something off of Cee Lo Greens album or an Adele track adds to the casual dining experience.  CPK has something for everyone. Atlas Park is pretty dull-city, but this restaurant brightens the whole place up.

Food and atmosphere are both great. Service is very fast and if you have to wait for a table, its usually never that long. The pizza's are unique and all have their little spin on it. I love their cobb salad!!! Also the chocolate banana cake is really, really good. Def my fave restaurant in Atlas!

The first time I went to CPK was with my co-worker.  After that visit, I brought my husband there.  It was quite something, as my husband is very picky on food and he used to never like any Western food.  After the visit, surprisingly he fell in love with their pizzas!  Since then we visited CPK almost every week - that is how addicted he is with them. There are only 3 CPKs I can find within New York boroughs, and I've been to all of them.  Glendale by far is the best one with environment. Things to recommend (Note that we are vegetarian but we are OK with eggs and diary products, so the choices do not have meat in them) : Pizzas:  1) Pear & Gorgonzola.  I would never thought of ordering this if it had not been recommended by my colleague.  It turned out to be our all time favorite.  Strange combination but it really brought out the best flavor from pear and the salad.  However, I just found out that their ranch dressing has fish byproduct in it, so vegetarians be aware.  You can ask for it without the ranch dressing though (might be less tasty). 2) Chipotle Chicken, but replace chicken with avocado.  It is spicy, but very tasty. 3) Wild Mushroom.  You can have it with chicken if you are not vegetarian, but without the chicken it tastes good as well. We also tried the Vegetarian with Japanese Eggplant pizza, but not really impressed with it.  That's mostly a standard pizza flavor pizza.  Another pizza I tried was the White Pizza, didn't like it either as it was way too cheesy for me.   I think my recommendation is to try something not so traditional and you might get amazed. Appetizer & drinks: 1) The MEDITERRANEAN Tortilla Spring Rolls and it was good.  Not super star but quite good. 2) Asparagus & Arugula Salad, also quite good. 3) Mint Ruby Cooler, with grapefruit juice and mint, quite good for summer.
I dont care for chain restaurants but my wife and kids drag me here. It's not bad food, very clean and  servers are nice. For that kind of money you can do a lot better plus $3.00 to park

This place has excellent entree salads, especially the Thai crunch chicken salad.  All the ingredients are very fresh, and well prepared.  I also had Pizza. The first time I liked it a lot. (It was plain.) The second time, not so much, but it might have been the type of pizza ordered. (I didn't order it, my DH did.)  Lastly, we ordered some sort of Asian dumplings, or spring rolls as an appetizer. They were very tasty. I looked at other people's plates and thought their food looked good.  (I always do that in restaraunts.) The portions are very generous.  I really liked the apple cobbler for dessert, and we did it complete, al la mode.  I'm glad we refrained from the extra hot carmel, because it would have been far too sweet, at least for my palate.  (But I'm not average.) This is probably one of the better places to eat at Atlas Park, and less pretentious than other restaraunts in this mall.   Get there early and be prepared to wait for a good 1/2 hour for a table, particularly on a Friday night. This is certainly not "fine dining", but you won't find that anywhere in a three zipcode radius from Atlas.

CPK is to pizza what Chili's is to Mexican or Fridays is to a steak/burger place.  That is not to say that their pizza is not good, because it actually is the best thing that they offer.  Just don't expect NY style pizza and make sure that whatever you order includes items that you know you like.  My only complaints with CPK is in regards to their other entree offerings and their cocktails.  The drinks taste very watered down and you find yourself questioning whether or not there is any liquor in them.  In regards to their entrees, I have ordered a chicken and salmon dish, both of the portions are incredibly small and overpriced.  When the waiter was question on the size of the salmon, he responded that the pieces get shipped to the restaurant already individually wrapped.  Kinda gross.  Haven't been back since that experience, but either way, the pizza is good!

I've been to CPK a few times and the food is good, I like the variety and the prices are good. I had to wait to be seated a few times just because they didn't have enough servers, not because the place was full, but that only happened during the week, they usually have enough staff during the weekends and at night.

I revisited my favorite restaurant CHAIN in the Middle Village area again this past Saturday night, and yet again I was very pleased. Myself and my girlfriend ordered the Sonora Egg Rolls. I was blown away by them. The filling was almost the exact same topping as is on our favorite pizza, the Chipotle Chicken pizza. After that amazing appetizer one would need something even better to follow it up, and the Chipotle Chicken pizza yet again did not disappoint. I think this weekend I will go to the one in Roosevelt Field and try it out.
love the service, presentation and acoomodation of this restaurant compared to other franchise. long island franchise needs to learn from this branch.

First let me start by saying this is not a review of the food. The food was great. I had the BBQ with bacon pizza, my husband had The Works, and my kids had the steak tacos. We loved our food and drinks. This issue that I have is with the service. We were seated quickly, no wait time. We sat in a booth by the left wall and the entrance. We sat for almost 10min before someone took our drink order. The server do not apologize for the delay, she just asked us for our drink order.  I feel that this lack of acknowledgment was rude. Since we waited so long we were able to give our entire order. She did not check on use at all once our meal was brought out to our table. It was not until the end of our meal that she brought us refills. I am not wanting someone to kiss my behind but as a prior server I expect courtesy and a friendly attitude. We gave her a 15% tip down to the penny, but I really could have left her nothing because she did not do anything.

Salads are really good. The chicken in the salads are very fresh all the time. They finally got some new pizzas to check out. All in all its a good place to grab a quick bite if you are undecided on what to eat. If you are in the mood for real good NY pizza, you must go elsewhere.

I came here today with three other friends. I've never been to a california pizza kitchen and i was very pleased. Food: Santa Fe Chicken Pizza- very good, except for the onions, had a really weird after taste. The sour cream, guacamole and salsa complimented the pizza very well. One thing that i didn't like was the crust, it was too soft, maybe the thin crust would've been a bit crispier, but that's just my taste. White pizza- i didn't eat this but my friends did, they loved it very much Spinach Artichoke dip- very delicious, i wish the tortilla chips weren't as broken up though they were too little for dipping **Note: the pizzas here are quite small, six small slices only, so me and my friend shared but since we had the appetizer it was more filling. If i was really hungry i could've finished the pie myself! Service: Very friendly waitress, and the pizzas and our appetizer came quite fast, i like to have my food out quick, but they werent too busy today either. Beverages: Kiwi Lemonade- sour and tangy very nice, mango lemonade- sweet, and really good!, Cherry Limeade- sweet and sour and really thirst quenching! The drinks here are really good, except their a little pricey Overall a great experience!

Used to come here on regular basis. Unfortunately this place went down the drain. From the moment we entered this time everything seemed different. Staff, vibe, lack of customers at first, followed by food that was the same only on the menu. In reality out of seven person party only one was satisfied with the food and drinks we ordered and used to love. Upon speaking with the waitress, our suspicion was confirmed - with the change of managerial staff, the place lost its quality and charm.

I have eaten at California Pizza Kitchen for a few years and I was pleased to hear that one finally opened at Atlas Park.   The pizzas themselves are quite unique and I find myself trying something new each and every time I walk in.   They have a great salad selection too with my favorite being the Waldorf.  (Just try to avert your gaze from the calorie count!) They offer their pizzas in both the regular deep dish or thin crust variety.  I myself go for the thin crust a lot more.   Overall, I love visiting CPK and go there at least once a month.

Who would think about frying macaroni and cheese? These people would.  Mac and cheese alone is death and now you're gonna fry it?  We didn't understand and ordered it and needless to say, after a bite it stayed on the plate.  Pizza was good though.  The stars are for pizza.m

The food and drinks are excellent.  Service is VERY SLOW.  the servers need and energizer battery to speed them up.. the first time my fiance and I went to CPK I ordered a strawberry mojito(if only the cups were bigger)  the server brings me my drink which tasted as if it were a virgin mojito(I'm no alcy but I do know what an alcoholic drink taste like) I told the server which took her 8 minutes to bring the drink back the same way i gave it to her, as if she placed it on the bar(I use to work within the restaurant industry and have bartended as well) therefore if anyone would know its me.  I approached the bartender telling her what I knew had happened which came across rude and told me I have to tell my server. The second encounter at CPK we waited 10 minutes to be greeted(mind you the place was surprisingly empty) after ordering drinks we then waited another 10 minutes for it to arrive. I would NOT recommend this CPK to anyone, not to mention the entrance to CPK where the carpet is smells like mold and mildew.

Not thrilled with this place at all.  Stopped in for a simple cup of cappuccino.  I should have went next door to Starbucks...but didn't. The cup was small....seriously, very small. It looked like an oversized expresso cup.  And to make matters worse, it arrived warm, not hot. But the topper was the bill:  $4.70.  It's the little things that really get me, and this "got me".  With tip, well over $5.00 for something that was so not worth it.
Fresh food and great service.  Nice pizza combinations and pasta dishes.  Nice selection of alcoholic beverages.

it was good for what it was - a quick, cheap meal before a movie. YOu can't expect real NY pizza - but your in queens so find it elsewhere.  CPK is great in its own way. Go adventurous with the pizza and you won't be let down.  The Hawaiian BBQ Chix was amazing.  Skip the appetizers... get a weird pizza.. enjoy.  The only thing - for 1st timers.. the pizza's are a bit bigger than personal size, but not big enough to split  - so leave leftovers, or try an appetizer to fill you up.

CPK is definitely one of my favorite chains. There is a variety of food (salads, pastas, pizza, sandwiches) and the food is consistently good. I'm not a fan of salads but their miso shrimp salad is so good! I've also tried almost all the appetizers and they are all good or very good. My favorite is the avocado egg rolls but it's so deadly - 1000 calories!!! The pizzas are hit or miss. They try too hard to make them different so sometimes they just end up being really weird like the Jamaican Jerk Chicken. I like the more typical pizzas like Meat Cravers and The Works which both have pepperoni and sausage.

The food here is very good, especially the pizza (one would hope) and the salads.  I have had a couple pasta dishes, and although they had great flavor, they were small overall.  The appetizers are also pretty good. The waiters and waitresses are friendly and mainly local but can sometimes stray and not be around for long periods of time.   The outdoor seating is nice, but there are always kids shouting and running around, so it gets loud.   If you are looking for a place to eat in the Shop at Atlas, I would reccomend California Pizza Kitchen.

They have great customer service!  The manager also goes around greeting damily and seeing how things are going. His ties are fun to look out for too! :) Their food is good and their deserts are delicious. Good enough to eat on your own big enough to share!  One time a waitress recommended this lemon chicken pasta... I didn't eat much mainly because it was lacking something but I was going to take it home and recook it. Then when I checked the bill the waitress didn't charge me and came over to tell me she knew I didn't like it. I went from confused to happy and she definitely got it in her tip.   This is the only place that I know changes your dish if you don't like it. I wouldn't recommend faking it nor eating most of it then claiming because most dishes are tasty and you don't want to get embarrassed if they question you. You must try the avocado egg roll! And the Blt pizza!

Love the food here. Great atmosphere and decor. I usually get friendly service in the 2 years I've frequented. Usually. I came in last Friday, early afternoon, to treat a friend to a birthday lunch and who had never been to California Pizza. As soon as we walked in, we were led to a small booth next to what appeared to be a class trip for kindergarten-ers. Noisy ones. That was to be expected from them, but I asked the older lady who seated us if we could possibly be seated elsewhere. The place was pretty empty, but she just snarled back, "They're leaving anyway." Uhh.... ok then. I used to be a hostess so I understand rotation... but the snarl and comment was not necessary, thanks. Needless to say, our waitress was friendlier, but not attentive. She visited our table 3x: once to take our drink orders, once for our meal orders and once to bring the check. During our meal, I kept looking around to find her because I did want to order dessert and food for take out---but being that she was never around or came by to check on us, I never did. So go for the food and drinks... just not during the early afternoon hours on Fridays.

I went to this place in the Atlas Mall and i love love love it! The food is delicious (well not my Alfredo because I've tried better but everything else) they have tons of different kinds of pizza and it's really original. I loved the atmosphere of the place very nice lighting and i loved seeing the brick ovens. It's honestly really pretty inside for a pizza spot. They don't only serve pizza but their known for their different pizza dishes. Their drinks to me were yummy and i went here twice. Once with some friends and once with a date and it was great both times. The prices are reasonable so eat eat! Everything is so fresh which is what i loved. Even the lettuce on the pizza (if you get a pizza with lettuce). But the decor is really nice, very cute for a simple date. Not for nothing for a chain it's nice cause i never seen pizza spots this nice! The pizzas are like personal size but not for nothing it really is a lot of pizza and it fills you up fast!

Love this place. The food is great and fresh. The staff are very friendly, attentive and fast. I love the decor of this place and it's very very clean. I never walk out of there without a smile on my face. Sometimes you end up waiting a little bit for your food, but the atmosphere there is so great that I don't mind half the time.

For a chain, CPK is pretty darn good.  I like to consider it the Cheesecake Factory of pizza chains, which is a compliment.  The pizza is tastey, but you have to appreciate it as its own entity.   If you're looking for a thin, traditional NYC, chewy-crust deal- go to a neighborhood joint.  This is "California" pizza- so I guess that means it's personal size,  has a bunch of unusual toppings, and  a sweet-ish crust.   As for the other stuff, the salads here are excellent- they are large, fresh, and definitely filling as a meal.  My sister got garlicky fettucini with shrimp, and she cleaned her plate.  I don't eat shrimp, so I didn't try it, but I could tell that the cream sauce was a good texture--it wasn't too thick like some cream sauces that end up congealing as the dish cools down. Last time I was here I got the sweet/spicy Italian sausage and peppers pizza.  (One of the most traditional on the menu.)   Good stuff- the spicy/sweet combo was nice, although I personally would have preferred a little more of the spicy side of the coin.  The pumpkin cheesecake here is absolutely phenomenal.  It has a gingerbread crust, a layer of cheesecake, and a layer of pumpkin pie.  I was "sharing" it with my sister, who I believe got about 3 bites in total.  Speaking of the Cheesecake Factory, they have them beat on this one... My one complaint was our server.  She let us sit for a loooong time before coming to take our order.   Then I proceeded to order a glass of Ravenswood Zinfandel, which was on the wine list under "Interesting Reds."  Red Zinfandel is one of my favorite red wines, and Ravenswood is a brand I have had before and enjoyed.  So our server brings me back a glass of something pink.  I do not drink pink wine under any circumstances, and I'm pretty sure that pink wine is not considered red.  Instead of apologizing (either for her mistake or for the mis-labeling on the menu) she argued with me for a few minutes, trying to convince me that this pink liquid was in fact Red Zinfandel. Long story short- I sent it back and ordered a nice safe Yellowtail Shiraz.  She gave us a bit of attitude from that point on, until she gave us the check, when of course she turned into an absolute peach. Overall, I like CPK- and it was nice to sit outside on a crisp fall night.

An acquaintance of mine (heh, Hi!) really enjoys their chicken roll appetizer, so whenever we are in the hood we come by and get that to go. Whenever I walk into this place, I'm always tempted to stay for dinner, but usually we have something else pressing to get to (that night, it was a sold-out showing of Inception at the nearby theater. Pressing, indeed.) But it is airy and gorgeous in there, nothing at all like what'd you expect from a national chain. And the chicken roll? Not a huge fan, since that's where you realize you're eating at a chain. Oversalted and unnecessarily greasy, it would taste better with less of both (a true rarity in casual dining and fast food).  But I'll be back to sample those alluring-looking bottles of Carlos Rossi (or some permutation) they have lining their bar (LOL!).
Umm the pizza is gross, yes...straight up gross. 2 stars just because the tuscan hummus appetizer was delicious. But dont eat the pizza.

What can I say: yum. It's not five-star dining, but CPK hits the spot. I really like this particular one, because it's located in the newly-opened Atlas Park shopping center in Queens. For those of you car-mobile, I highly recommend a visit. The landscaping is very nice, and it's very green. It's the perfect dinner-and-a-movie spot (there a multiplex there too).   CPK's not for the diet-conscious, but satisfying in moderation. I always get the tricolor salad (no crust) and one of the pastas. I've never tried their desserts, but the wine list is pretty good for a chain restaurant. I don't recommend the mixed drinks. Oh, and bring a sweater or something long-sleeve -- they're known to blast their A/C during warm months.

Holy fucking crap i love this place! Its super clean, the people are nice, and the food is really great, always fresh!  The portions are huge, i always go with a friend and split a pizza and get a half salad for my self. Only problem is there not consistent, one day i can wait like 1omins for my meal, and other time and can wait an hour. I actually had a waitress tell me that it took an hour to make a pizza, nah uh  it takes 15mins tops, or so ive be told by a  friend (3rd generation pizzeria owner) Even wen people lie to me about pizza times, i still like this place. I think i could walk in and be hit in the face, and i would still ask for half a Thai Crunch Salad and a shrimp pizza!

If you read the other reviews, there are plenty of customer service comments.  Well here's mine.  I've been here several times because this is the closest CPK by me.  Come here for the pizza mostly, but my favorite is the chicken club sandwich.  One commenter states too salty: that can be true at times.  Customer service is bearable.  Not even Good.  There is one manager that's nice, but he's not there everyday.  Otherwise other staff needs to be trained better/more.  Commenter states took so many staff to get them A Glass of Water: True.  There was one manager that brought our ordered pizza to our table without saying anything: Just dropped the pizza at the edge of the table and left.  What if that wasn't ours?  I wouldn't have time to say "excuse me" because he left the second the plate hit the table.  I know some would say 'how do you know that was a manager?': he was wearing a regular suit rather than the waiter uniform.  I dread coming here because of the staff.  I just really come for the food.  One more annoying thing:  you have to go through this little hallway, right next to the kitchen entrance to get to the bathrooms.  PS  I've been here both weekdays and weekends.

Yummie Yummie in my tummie. The food here was very good, although i got a salad , it was the best cesar salad and biggest that i've ever had. The Jerk Pizza that my brother ordered for everyone to try, was so delicious. I highly recommend the fish tacos....they give you a great portion plus cunchy corn chips on the side . The price is pretty reasonable for the great portions.
